title: TVLine Items: Gypsy Rose Premiere Date, A Real Pain on Hulu and More
description: Gypsy Rose Blanchard is ready to bloom again this spring on Lifetime. Season 2 of the reality series Gypsy Rose: Life After Lock Up, which chronicles Blanchard’s life after her release from prison, will premiere Monday, March 10 at 9/8c on Lifetime, the network has announced. The sophomore season “will follow Gypsy’s emotionally charged journey […]
author: Vlada Gelman
excerpt: Gypsy Rose Blanchard is ready to bloom again this spring — get a sneak peek at Season 2 of her Lifetime reality series.
text: Gypsy Rose Blanchard is ready to bloom again this spring on Lifetime. Season 2 of the reality series Gypsy Rose: Life After Lock Up, which chronicles Blanchard’s life after her release from prison, will premiere Monday, March 10 at 9/8c on Lifetime, the network has announced. The sophomore season “will follow Gypsy’s emotionally charged journey as she navigates her newfound freedom, rebuilds relationships, handles pregnancy and new motherhood, all while remaining on parole.” Watch a sneak peek here: Ready for some more recent newsy nuggets? Well… * A Real Pain, starring newly minted Golden Globe winner Kieran Culkin and writer/director Jesse Eisenberg, will make its streaming debut on Hulu on Thursday, Jan. 16. * Joey King and Cooper Koch will announce this year’s Screen Actors Guild Award nominations this Wednesday, starting at 10:30 am ET/7:30 am PT, exclusively on Netflix’s YouTube channel. The SAG Awards ceremony will air on Netflix on Sunday, Feb. 23. * The Detroit Lions’ 31-9 win over the Minnesota Vikings delivered the most-watched NBC Sunday Night Football season finale since 2012, with an average of 28.5 million viewers (across NBC, Peacock, NBC Sports Digital platforms and NFL Digital platforms). * The WWE’s 39th annual Royal Rumble will be held in January 2026 in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia — the first time the event will be hosted outside of North America. * Paramount+ has announced that the first installment of its new anthology series will be titled Unspeakable: The Murder of JonBenét Ramsey. As previously reported, Melissa McCarthy and Clive Owen will star as Patsy and John Bennett Ramsey. * Kevin Nealon’s self-produced talk show Hiking With Kevin, in which Nealon is joined by celebrity guests such as Conan O’Brien, Rob Lowe, Nikki Glaser, David Spade and Martin Short as they hike together, has landed at streamer Fox Nation, per The Hollywood Reporter. Which of today’s TVLine Items pique your interest?
html:
Gypsy Rose Blanchard is ready to bloom again this spring on Lifetime.

Season 2 of the reality series Gypsy Rose: Life After Lock Up, which chronicles Blanchard’s life after her release from prison, will premiere Monday, March 10 at 9/8c on Lifetime, the network has announced. The sophomore season “will follow Gypsy’s emotionally charged journey as she navigates her newfound freedom, rebuilds relationships, handles pregnancy and new motherhood, all while remaining on parole.”

Watch a sneak peek here:

Ready for some more recent newsy nuggets? Well…

* A Real Pain, starring newly minted Golden Globe winner Kieran Culkin and writer/director Jesse Eisenberg, will make its streaming debut on Hulu on Thursday, Jan. 16.

* Joey King and Cooper Koch will announce this year’s Screen Actors Guild Award nominations this Wednesday, starting at 10:30 am ET/7:30 am PT, exclusively on Netflix’s YouTube channel. The SAG Awards ceremony will air on Netflix on Sunday, Feb. 23.

* The Detroit Lions’ 31-9 win over the Minnesota Vikings delivered the most-watched NBC Sunday Night Football season finale since 2012, with an average of 28.5 million viewers (across NBC, Peacock, NBC Sports Digital platforms and NFL Digital platforms).

* The WWE’s 39th annual Royal Rumble will be held in January 2026 in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia — the first time the event will be hosted outside of North America.

* Paramount+ has announced that the first installment of its new anthology series will be titled Unspeakable: The Murder of JonBenét Ramsey. As previously reported, Melissa McCarthy and Clive Owen will star as Patsy and John Bennett Ramsey.

* Kevin Nealon’s self-produced talk show Hiking With Kevin, in which Nealon is joined by celebrity guests such as Conan O’Brien, Rob Lowe, Nikki Glaser, David Spade and Martin Short as they hike together, has landed at streamer Fox Nation, per The Hollywood Reporter.

Which of today’s TVLine Items pique your interest?
